title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5329.25 - Prohibited actions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 5329.25 - Prohibited actions

State Regulations
(a) Dishonest obtaining of a benefit. No person shall, in relation to an authorized wager, obtain a benefit by any dishonest act, practice or scheme or otherwise
dishonestly obtain a benefit through the use of any device or item. (b) Altering or
falsification of information. Any person who knowingly alters or falsifies information
recorded on any record, document or report required under this Part, for any
purpose, including, without limitation, for the purpose of concealment, deception or circumvention of minimum internal control procedures, may be
subject to penalties and other actions the commission may take pursuant to law
(
e.g., a fine, penalty or revocation of a sports pool license
by the commission). Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
5329.25

Adopted

New

York State Register June 26, 2019/Volume XLI, Issue 26, eff. 6/26/2019

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
